title.title: Track improvement works on the Central Line

texts: The Central line will be suspended between Grange Hill and Newbury Park on the weekend of the 18/19 June 2005, due to track improvement works taking place between Grange Hill and Hainault.
Customers are advised to allow an extra 15 minutes
The works are being carried out by Metronet BCV.
A rail replacement bus service will operate between Grange Hill and Newbury Park calling at all intermediate stations.
Passengers travelling from Hainault, Fairlop and Barkingside should use the rail replacement service to/from Newbury Park and change there for the train service.
Passengers travelling from Grange Hill to Roding Valley stations will enjoy a direct service to central London.
Customers are advised to allow an extra 15 minutes to complete their journeys, especially those wishing to make the last train connections.
For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call 020 7222 1234 or visit TfL's website .

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Metronet Rail BCV is responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Bakerloo, Central, Victoria and Waterloo \u0026 City lines","TfL is investing Â£10 billion over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, over half of that in the Tube."]}
